page.title: 19EDUCATION
page.content: In the Weaverham/Hartford block there is one High School for children aged 11-16.Children go to Sir John Deane's Sixth Form College in Northwich to take their A Levels.There are four Primary Schools, Weaverham Forest, Wallerscote, Hartford C.p. and St. Bede's R.C. School. The private school The Grange caters for all ages between 4 and 18. Wallerscote and Weaverham Forest are both suffering from the 1980s problem of 'falling rolls'. There is little school building around Weaverham and smaller families proportionately affect school rolls. Wallerscote Infant and junior schools have now merged onto the Junior site.Weaverham Forest has been able to set up a Craft room and library using empty class rooms.
